meanings.definition: A viscous liquid derived from petroleum, used as a fuel or lubricant.
meanings.sent1: The car engine needed oil to run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She poured oil into the lamp to light up the room.
meanings.sent3: The oil spilled on the floor made it slippery like a slide.
meanings.sent4: His words were like oil, soothing her worries.
meanings.sent5: The oil glistened under the sun, reflecting rainbows of color.

meanings.definition: A substance used for cooking or flavoring, derived from plants or animals.
meanings.sent1: The chef used olive oil to sauté the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The popcorn tasted delicious with a drizzle of buttery oil.
meanings.sent3: The oil in the salad dressing made the lettuce dance with flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the oil that greased the wheels of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of sizzling oil filled the kitchen, making mouths water.

meanings.definition: To apply oil to something, typically to lubricate or protect it.
meanings.sent1: He would oil the hinges of the squeaky door every month.
meanings.sent2: She decided to oil her bicycle chain before the long ride.
meanings.sent3: The magician oiled his wand, claiming it would perform better.
meanings.sent4: Time had oiled the gears of their relationship, making it stronger.
meanings.sent5: The athlete oiled his muscles before the race, ready for peak performance.
